href.description: This is the target URI â€“ can be specified as a Relative Reference or fully-qualified URI. Relative Reference should be used along with the di parameter to make it unique.

rel.description: The relation of the target URI referenced by the link to the context URI

if.description: ReadOnly, The interface set supported by this resource

di.description: The Device ID on which the Relative Reference in href is to be resolved on. Base URI should be used in preference where possible

buri.description: The base URI used to fully qualify a Relative Reference in the href parameter. Use the OCF Schema for URI

p.description: ReadOnly, Specifies the framework policies on the Resource referenced by the target URI

bm.description: ReadOnly, Specifies the framework policies on the Resource referenced by the target URI for e.g. observable and discoverable

sec.description: ReadOnly, Specifies if security needs to be turned on when looking to interact with the Resource

port.description: ReadOnly, Secure port to be used for connection

q.description: This defines the query string to be used when batch request is forwarded through this Link

title.description: A title for the link relation. Can be used by the UI to provide a context

anchor.description: This is used to override the context URI e.g. override the URI of the containing collection

oneOf.description: An ordinal number that is not repeated - must be unique in the collection context
Any unique string including a URI
Use UUID for universal uniqueness - used in /oic/res to identify the device

ins.description: The instance identifier for this web link in an array of web links - used in collections

type.description: A hint at the representation of the resource referenced by the target URI. This represents the media types that are used for both accepting and emitting
